member.name: T:AssemblyNameSpace.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This is a project to build a piece of software that is able to rebuild a protein sequence from reads of a massspectrometer. The software is build by Douwe Schulte and was started on 25-03-2019. It is build in collaboration with and under supervision of Joost Snijder, from the group "Massspectrometry and Proteomics" at the university of Utrecht.

member.name: T:AssemblyNameSpace.ToRunWithCommandLine
member.summary: A Class to be able to run the code from the commandline. To be able to test it easily. This will be rewritten when the code is moved to its new repository

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.ToRunWithCommandLine.Main
member.summary: The method that will be run if the code is run from the command line. This exists because the code needs to be tested.

member.name: T:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler
member.summary: The Class with all code to assemble Peptide sequences.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.reads
member.summary: The reads fed into the Assembler, as opened by OpenReads.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.graph
member.summary: The De Bruijn graph used by the Assembler.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.condensed_graph
member.summary: The condensed graph used to store the output of the assembly.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.kmer_length
member.summary: The length of the k-mers used to create the De Bruijn graph. Private member where it is stored.

member.name: P:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Kmer_length
member.summary: The length of the k-mers used to create the De Bruijn graph. Get and Set is public.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.scoring_matrix
member.summary: The matrix used for scoring of the alignment between two characters in the alphabet. As such this matrix is rectangular.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.alphabet
member.summary: The alphabet used for alignment. The default value is all the amino acids in order of natural abundance in prokaryotes to make finding the right amino acid a little bit faster.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.minimum_homology
member.summary: The private member to store the minimum homology value in.

member.name: P:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Minimum_homology
member.summary: The minimum homology value of an edge to include it in the graph. Lowering the limit could result in a longer sequence retrieved from the algorithm but would also greatly increase the computational cost of the calculation.
member.value: The minimum homology before including an edge in the graph.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.edge_include_limit
member.summary: The limit to include edges when filtering on highest edges. It will be used to include not only the highest but (depending on the value) a couple more edges.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.meta_data
member.summary: To contain meta information about how the program ran to make informed decisions on how to choose the values of variables and to aid in debugging.

member.name: T:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid
member.summary: A struct to function as a wrapper for AminoAcid information, so custom alphabets can be used in an efficient way

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.parent
member.summary: The Assembler used to create the AminoAcd, used to get the information of the alphabet.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.code
member.summary: The code (index of the char in the alpabet array of the parent).

member.name: P:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.Code
member.summary: The code (index of the char in the alpabet array of the parent). Gives only a Get option. The only way to change it is in the creator.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.#ctor(AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler,System.Char)
member.summary: The creator of AminoAcids.
member.param: The Assembler that this AminoAcid is used in, to get the alphabet.
The character to store in this AminoAcid.
member.returns: Returns a reference to the new AminoAcid.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.ToString
member.summary: Will create a string of this AminoAcid. Consiting of the character used to create this AminoAcid.
member.returns: Returns the character of this AminoAcid (based on the alphabet) as a string.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.ArrayToString(AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid[])
member.summary: Will create a string of an array of AminoAcids.
member.param: The array to create a string from.
member.returns: Returns the string of the array.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: To check for equality of the AminoAcids. Will return false if the object is not an AminoAcid.
member.param: The object to check equality with.
member.returns: Returns true when the Amino Acids are equal.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.ArrayEquals(AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid[],AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid[])
member.summary: To check for equality of arrays of AminoAcids.
member.remarks: Implemented as a short circuiting loop with the equals operator (==).
member.param: The first object to check equality with.
The second object to check equality with.
member.returns: Returns true when the aminoacid arrays are equal.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.op_Equality(AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid,AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid)
member.summary: To check for equality of AminoAcids.
member.remarks: Implemented as a check for equality of the Code of both AminoAcids.
member.param: The first AminoAcid to test.
The second AminoAcid to test.
member.returns: Returns true when the Amino Acids are equal.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.op_Inequality(AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid,AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid)
member.summary: To check for inequality of AminoAcids.
member.remarks: Implemented as a a reverse of the equals operator.
member.param: The first AminoAcid to test.
The second AminoAcid to test.
member.returns: Returns false when the Amino Acids are equal.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.GetHashCode
member.summary: To get a hashcode for this AminoAcid.
member.returns: Returns the hascode of the AminoAcid.

members.member: Calculating homology, using the scoring matrix of the parent Assembler. Depending on which rules are put into the scoring matrix the order in which this function is evaluated could differ. a.Homology(b) does not have to be equal to b.Homology(a). The other AminoAcid to use. Returns the homology score (based on the scoring matrix) of the two AminoAcids. See for the scoring matrix. See on how to change the scoring matrix.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid.ArrayHomology(AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid[],AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid[])
member.summary: Calculating homology between two arrays of AminoAcids, using the scoring matrix of the parent Assembler.
member.remarks: Two arrays of different length will result in a value of 0. This function loops over the AminoAcids and returns the sum of the homology value between those.
member.param: The first object to calculate homology with.
The second object to calculate homology with.
member.returns: Returns the homology bewteen the two aminoacid arrays.

member.name: T:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node
member.summary: Nodes in the graph with a sequence length of K-1.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.sequence
member.summary: The member to store the sequence information in.

member.name: P:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.Sequence
member.summary: The sequence of the Node. Only has a getter.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.multiplicity
member.summary: The member to store the multiplicity (amount of k-mers which result in the same (k-1)-mers in.

member.name: P:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.Multiplicity
member.summary: The multiplicity, amount of k-mers which result in the same (k-1)-mers, of the Node. Only has a getter.
member.value: The amount of time an equal (k-1)-mer was found in the set of generated k-mers, this tells something about the amount of reads that have the overlap over this sequence, and about the amount of equal parts of the sequence in other places of the protein.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.forwardEdges
member.summary: The list of edges from this Node. The tuples contain the index of the Node where the edge goes to, the homology with the first Node and the homology with the second Node in this order. The private member to store the list.

member.name: P:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.ForwardEdges
member.summary: The list of edges going from this node.
member.value: The list of edges from this Node. The tuples contain the index of the Node where the edge goes to, the homology with the first Node and the homology with the second Node in this order. Only has a getter.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.backwardEdges
member.summary: The list of edges to this Node. The tuples contain the index of the Node where the edge goes to, the homology with the first Node and the homology with the second Node in this order. The private member to store the list.

member.name: P:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.BackwardEdges
member.summary: The list of edges going to this node.
member.value: The list of edges to this Node. The tuples contain the index of the Node where the edge goes to, the homology with the first Node and the homology with the second Node in this order. Only has a getter.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.Visited
member.summary: Whether or not this node is visited yet.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.max_forward_score
member.summary: Highest score yet for forward edges, used in filtering only the highest edges.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.max_backward_score
member.summary: Highest score yet for backward edges, used in filtering only the highest edges.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.edge_include_limit
member.summary: The limit to include edges when filtering on highest edges. It will be used to include not only the highest but (depending on the value) a couple more edges.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.#ctor(AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The creator of Nodes.
member.param: The sequence of this Node.
The multiplicity of this Node.
The limit to include edges when filtering.
member.remarks: It will initialize the edges list.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.AddForwardEdge(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: To add a forward edge to the Node. Wil only be added if the score is high enough.
member.param: The index of the Node where this edge goes to.
The homology of the edge with the first Node.
The homology of the edge with the second Node.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.AddBackwardEdge(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: To add a backward edge to the Node.
member.param: The index of the Node where this edge comes from.
The homology of the edge with the first Node.
The homology of the edge with the second Node.

members.member: Filters the forward edges based on the highest score found yet and the edge include limit. See for the edge include limit. See for the highest score.
Filters the backward edges based on the highest score found yet and the edge include limit. See for the edge include limit. See for the highest score.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.HasForwardEdges
member.summary: To check if the Node has forward edges.
member.returns: Returns true if the node has forward edges.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.HasBackwardEdges
member.summary: To check if the Node has backward edges.
member.returns: Returns true if the node has backward edges.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.EdgesCount
member.summary: To get the amount of edges (forward and backward).
member.returns: The amount of edges (forwards and backwards).

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.MaxForwardEdge
member.summary: Gets the forward edge with the highest total homology of all edges in this Node.
member.returns: It returns the index of the Node where the edge goes to, the homology with the first Node and the homology with the second Node in this order.
member.exception: It will result in an Exception if the Node has no forward edges.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Node.MaxBackwardEdge
member.summary: Gets the backward edge with the highest total homology of all edges in this Node.
member.returns: It returns the index of the Node where the edge goes to, the homology with the first Node and the homology with the second Node in this order.
member.exception: It will result in an Exception if the Node has no backward edges.

member.name: T:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.MetaInformation
member.summary: A struct to hold meta information about the assembly to keep it organised and to report back to the user.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.MetaInformation.total_time
member.summary: The total time needed to run Assemble(). See

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.MetaInformation.pre_time
member.summary: The needed to do the pre work, creating k-mers and (k-1)-mers. See

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.MetaInformation.graph_time
member.summary: The time needed the build the graph. See

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.MetaInformation.path_time
member.summary: The time needed to find the path through the de Bruijn graph. See

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.MetaInformation.sequence_filter_time
member.summary: The time needed to filter the sequences. See

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.MetaInformation.reads
member.summary: The amount of reads used by the program. See . See

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.MetaInformation.kmers
member.summary: The amount of k-mers generated. See

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.MetaInformation.kmin1_mers
member.summary: The amount of (k-1)-mers generated. See

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.MetaInformation.kmin1_mers_raw
member.summary: The amount of (k-1)-mers generated, before removing all duplicates. See

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.MetaInformation.sequences
member.summary: The number of sequences found. See

member.name: T:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.CondensedNode
member.summary: Nodes in the condensed graph with a variable sequence length.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.CondensedNode.Index
member.summary: The index this node. The index is defined as the index in the adjecency list of the de Bruijn graph.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.CondensedNode.Visited
member.summary: Whether or not this node is visited yet.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.CondensedNode.Sequence
member.summary: The sequence of this node. It is the longest constant sequence to be found in the de Bruijn graph starting at the Index. See

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.CondensedNode.ForwardEdges
member.summary: The list of forward edges, defined as the indexes in the de Bruijn graph.

member.name: F:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.CondensedNode.BackwardEdges
member.summary: The list of backward edges, defined as the indexes in the de Bruijn graph.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.CondensedNode.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.AminoAcid},System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates a condensed node to be used in the condensed graph.
member.param: The sequence of this node. See
The index of the node, the index in the de Bruijn graph. See
The forward edges from this node (indexes). See
The backward edges from this node (indexes). See

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The creator, to set up the default values. Also sets the standard alphabet.
member.param: The lengths of the k-mers.
The minimum homology needed to be inserted in the graph as an edge.
The limit to include edges when filtering.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.getIndexInAlphabet(System.Char)
member.summary: Find the index of the given character in the alphabet.
member.param: The character to look op.
member.returns: The index of the character in the alphabet or -1 if it is not in the alphabet.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.SetAlphabet(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.ValueTuple{System.Char,System.Char,System.Int32,System.Boolean}},System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Set the alphabet of the assembler.
member.param: A list of rules implemented as tuples containing the chars to connect, the value to put into the matrix and whether or not the rule should be bidirectional (the value in the matrix is the same both ways).
The value to place on the diagonals of the matrix.
The alphabet to use, it will be iterated over from the front to the back so the best case scenario has the most used characters at the front of the string.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.OpenReads(System.String)
member.summary: To open a file with reads (should always be run before trying to assemble). It will save the reads in the current Assembler object.
member.param: The path to the file to read from.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.Assemble
member.summary: Assemble the reads into the graph, this is logically (one of) the last metods to run on an Assembler, all settings should be defined before running this.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.Assembler.OutputReport
member.summary: Outputs some information about the assembly the help validate the output of the assembly.

member.name: T:AssemblyNameSpace.HelperFunctionality
member.summary: A class to store extension methods to help in the process of coding.

member.name: M:AssemblyNameSpace.HelperFunctionality.SubArray``1(``0[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: To copy a subarray to a new array.
member.param: The old array to copy from.
The index to start copying.
The length of the created subarray.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the array.
member.returns: Returns a new array with clones of the original array.
